文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: During aqueous corrosion of zirconium alloys, a fraction of the hydrogen generated by the metal-water reaction is absorbed by the metal. This hydriding can result in a loss of ductility in zirconium alloy components if hydrogen absorption is appreciable.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: Tests have shown that hydriding can be accelerated in zirconium alloys when they are coupled to other metals.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: In neutral water at 360°C, hydrogen absorption by zirconium alloys in H₂O was up to twice as great as the equivalent hydrogen absorbed in reactor-grade D₂O.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: In tests with D₂O where alkalinity was maintained with lithium hydroxide, hydrogen rather than deuterium was the predominant species absorbed.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: Large hydrogen overpressures [4] and highly alkaline solutions [5] both increase the susceptibility to hydrogen absorption in high-temperature water.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: specimens of cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb fuel sheathing were shrink-fitted onto plugs machined from nickel, Type 410 stainless steel, Type 304 stainless steel, and copper bar stock

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: the fuel sheathing (~0.46 mm thick) was given a flash pickle in a HF/H₂SO₄/HNO₃/H₂O solution

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: The specimens were exposed to hydrogenated, lithiated water at 300°C in a one-litre static autoclave.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: some Zr-2.5Nb specimens were prefilmed in 400°C steam for 24 h before being coupled

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: One set of specimens was irradiated in pressurized water at 553 to 563 K for 147 days in the NRU reactor

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: The water was lithiated (pH 10.0 to 10.5) for the first 100 days and ammoniated (pH 7.2 to 7.8) for the remaining 47 days.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: Zr-2.5Nb appears more sensitive to increasing LiOH concentration than does Zircaloy-2

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: Corrosion of both Zircaloy-2 and Zr-2.5Nb is about 20% greater in H2O than in D2O at a concentration of added LiOH of 4.2×10^-1 mol/L

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: Zr-2.5Nb coupled to 410 SS: Weight Gain In-Reactor 20.5 mg/dm²

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: The absence of any pressure dependence for both Types 410 and 304 stainless steel

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: increased hydrogen absorption of coupled specimens was still observed

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: oxide film on the nickel plug may have reduced its permeability to hydrogen

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: Zirconium alloys are generally considered to be anodic with respect to stainless steels and high-nickel alloys

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: Prefilming Zr-2.5Nb specimens prior to coupling with Type 410 stainless steel probably eliminated accelerated hydriding

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: The corrosion of both Zircaloy-2 and Zr-2.5Nb is strongly influenced by increasing LiOH concentration in both H2O and D2O

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: overall preference for hydrogen over deuterium is as much as 1000 to 1 for Zircaloy-2 and up to 3000 to 1 for Zr-2.5Nb

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: The calculated ratio of [OD-]/[OH-] in these tests ranged from about 460 to 1 at 4.2×10^-4 mol LiOH/L to about 170 to 1 at 4.2×10^-1 mol LiOH/L

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_039_chunk5
证据片段: A strong preference for hydrogen absorption over deuterium absorption was evident in these tests
